captions.text: He's here?

Yeah, we saw
his car on the way,
At the hotel.
Huh.

I see you
got my letters.
Finally.

What are you
going to do, al?
I don't know.
We're back to that?
Are we back there?

What about
the past couple of days?
They happened, you know?

I know that they happened,
and they were wonderful,

But they were also
very irresponsible.

I have a fiance
waiting for me
at a hotel,

- Who's going to be
crushed when he finds out.
- So you make love to me

And then you go back
to your husband?
Was that your plan?

Was that a test
that I didn't pass?!

No, I made a promise
to a man, he gave me a ring
and I gave him my word.

- And your word is shot
to hell now, don't you think?
- I don't-- I don't know.

I'll find out
when I talk to him.

This is not about
keeping your promise,

And it's not about
following your heart,
It's about security.

- What is that supposed to mean?
- Money!

- What are you ta--
- he's got a lot of money.

- Now I hate you,
you smug bastard.
- Well, I hate you.

- If you leave here, I hate you.
- You wou--

- Hate you if you leave here.
- Have you been paying attention
to anything that's happening?

I guess not.
I think I must have
misread all of those signals.
I guess you did.

You're bored.
You're bored
and you know it.

You wouldn't
be here if there
wasn't something missing.

You arrogant
son of a bitch!

Would you just
stay with me?

Stay with you?
What for?

- Look at us,
we're already fighting.
- Well, that's what we do.
We fight.

You tell me when I'm being
an arrogant son of a bitch

And I tell you when you're
being a pain in the ass.

comments.text:
I saw Ryan Gosling at a grocery store in Los Angeles yesterday. I told him 
how cool it was to meet him in person, but I didn’t want to be a douche and 
bother him and ask him for photos or anything.

He said, “Oh, like you’re doing now?”

I was taken aback, and all I could say was “Huh?” but he kept cutting me 
off and going “huh? huh? huh?” and closing his hand shut in front of my 
face. I walked away and continued with my shopping, and I heard him chuckle 
as I walked off. When I came to pay for my stuff up front I saw him trying 
to walk out the doors with like fifteen Milky Ways in his hands without 
paying.

The girl at the counter was very nice about it and professional, and was 
like “Sir, you need to pay for those first.” At first he kept pretending to 
be tired and not hear her, but eventually turned back around and brought 
them to the counter.

When she took one of the bars and started scanning it multiple times, he 
stopped her and told her to scan them each individually “to prevent any 
electrical infetterence,” and then turned around and winked at me. I don’t 
even think that’s a word. After she scanned each bar and put them in a bag 
and started to say the price, he kept interrupting her by yawning really 
loudly.﻿

comments.text:
Ah yes, the age old battle with women:

Meal time:
"What do you want to eat?"
'I don't know'
"I want to eat Chinese"
'I don't'
"Well what do you want?"
'I don't know, it's not that simple'

Argument:
"What do you want? What are you mad about?"
'I don't know' or *silence* 
"What am I doing that is making you mad?"
'You should already know. I don't know, it's not that simple'

Generally speaking, men are direct and don't beat around the bush. We want 
straight up, honest, no-bs answers that are clear and logical. Most females 
are indirect and avoid dealing with things right away and from the front, 
which is why you'll hear about something you did three months ago when you 
have an argument even though she never brought it up when it actually 
happened. ﻿

sad that the camera isn't towards her face.

memories related.﻿

comments.author: T Bond

comments.text:
I watch this scene over and over and it is scary how this scene is 
identical to the situation my ex and myself are in. She comes from a life 
of privilege and I come from a blue collar family. She is Jewish and has 
been raised to value Money, Education and Status above all. Love ranks 4th 
or 5th on her list as that's what's been taught her entire life. She still 
calls all the time, still texts and still tells me how much she loves me. 
Cries, emails ...  I should have been gone over a year ago as her parents 
view me as a disease ... She is so confused just like Allie in this scene 
... She loves me as much as I love her and I constantly ask her the same 
question he asks her in this scene ... "Forget about your parents, what do 
you want?" .... She always comes back no matter how controlling her parents 
are and no matter what she has been taught ... I see it in her eyes, I hear 
it in her voice and I feel it in my heart and hers ... I love her so much 
and all I want is to lay next to her every night and love her more each 
day. I see a lot of her in this character and I see a lot of me in his 
character ... I love this movie because the similarities are scary and the 
outcome is magical ... Love does concur all and I will never give up on her 
(in a legal / non creepy / romantic way) lol ... I love you so much B ... 
More than words will ever explain﻿

comments.author: luyzon77

comments.text:
+Yordanka O'Callaghan  I know that the only way out of this is by moving 
forward. Its just so hard to let go of someone who once made me so happy. 
That one person who once made me feel so whole suddenly make me feel so 
broken. I've had many broken bones, I've had plenty nasty injuries and 
illnesses, but none of those compare to the hurt and anger of seeing the 
man I love more that anything in this world turn his back on me and walk 
away. He was my first love and I don't feel ready to let go of that. But I 
realize now that I don't have any other choice I have to stop sulking about 
it and move on from the past.. Thank you for taking your time in writing 
that comment it helped a lot :) xx Life goes on I guess
comments.author: Annie Black

comments.text:
+Annie Black this wounded feeling will pass, give yourself some time. Do 
not blame Love for the shortcomings of someone. Learn to live without this 
man, learn to enjoy life in general, despite the gap that he left behind in 
your heart. It will heal. I know its hard to believe me now, but I can 
assure you - it WILL heal. Do concentrate on the future, expect better 
things, better life and most importantly- better man, who will appreciate 
you. Sometimes people leave your life for only one reason - to make a space 
for someone more suitable and good for you. :) Keep your head up and smile 
<3
comments.author: Yordanka O'Callaghan

comments.text:

be with anyone else.
